SQL_Database module¶

class SQL_Database.SQL_Databases(path='CasinoBackEnd/CasinoDatabase.db')¶

Bases: object

This class is used for executing SQL queries using Python. Default path to ‘CasinoDatabase.db’

create_table(tableName, tableAttributes)¶

Create table [tableName] ([tableAttributes]);

create_table_input_terminal()¶

Open consol input: Create table [consoleInput] ([consoleInput]);

delete_from_table_where(table, column, condition)¶

DELETE FROM [TABLE] WHERE [COLUMN] = [CONDITION]

exec_and_commit(cmd)¶

Execute SQL command and update the database.

get_last_rowID(table)¶

Get the number of rows ever created.

get_partial_matches(table, row, column, condition)¶

Return an array of rows that contain partial matches of a word in a table.

insert_into_table_values(table, value)¶

INSERT INTO [TABLE] VALUES ([VALUE])

queary_table_all_atributes(tableName)¶

Select * From [tableName]

select_from(tableName, attributes)¶

Select [attributes] From [tableName]

select_from_where(table, row, column, condition)¶

SELECT [ROW] FROM [TABLE] WHERE [COLUMN] = [CONDITION]

set_database_path(path)¶

Set database path or name.

update_set_where(table, newInfo, condition)¶

UPDATE [table] SET [newInfo] WHERE [condition]

Ex: UPDATE PlayerMain SET Last = ‘Doe’, First = ‘John’ WHERE ID = ‘12345’

table = “PlayerMain”

newInfo = “Last = ‘Doe’, First = ‘John’”

condition = “ID = ‘12345’”
